quoteLast: ) could have been seen from the house. The beam of such a light can be visible for great distances. Reflected from the clouds and spread by the drops of moisture in the air, it could easily have flashed into the window with great brilliance.

quoteFirst: All the same it was a trying life owing to the difficulty of getting a normal amount of sleep. We had to “stand to” from
quoteLast: till dawn, and then work till breakfast, and on to about 9.30 A.M. By that time it was too hot to do any more, and the rest of the day had to be spent in idleness. Few of us could sleep during the day because of the heat, and the temperature seldom began to get much cooler before 8.30 P.M., and sometimes later.

quoteFirst: If only Smith had been shut up next door to me I might have been able to shout to him so that he could hear, but what chance was there when three or four rooms at least divided us? So I sat down again in my corner and sulkily watched the first glimmers of dawn peep in at the little window.  It must be
quoteLast: , I thought.  And that meant four good hours before any chance of a release came.
